about.name: Cairo
about.info_text: Cairo, the capital of Egypt, is a city steeped in history and culture. Located on the banks of the Nile River, Cairo is one of the oldest cities in the world and a gateway to Egypt's ancient wonders. The city is known for its iconic landmarks, including the Pyramids of Giza and the Sphinx. Visitors to Cairo can explore historic sites, vibrant markets, and experience the rich tapestry of Egyptian life. The city offers a unique blend of the ancient and the modern, making it a captivating destination for travelers from around the globe.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 9.5 million (Greater Cairo)
Governorate: Cairo
Time Zone: Eastern European Time (UTC+02:00)
Language: Arabic
Currency: Egyptian Pound (EGP)
about.climate_text: Cairo has a desert climate with hot, dry summers and mild winters. The city enjoys plenty of sunshine throughout the year, making it an ideal destination for outdoor exploration.

attractions_card.title: Pyramids of Giza
attractions_card.description: The Pyramids of Giza, including the Great Pyramid, are world-famous ancient structures and one of the Seven Wonders of the World. Visitors can explore these incredible monuments and the nearby Sphinx.

attractions_card.title: Khan el-Khalili Market
attractions_card.description: Khan el-Khalili is a bustling bazaar in the heart of Old Cairo, offering a wide variety of goods, from traditional crafts and spices to jewelry and clothing. It's a great place to shop and experience local culture.

attractions_card.title: Egyptian Museum
attractions_card.description: The Egyptian Museum is home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian artifacts, including the treasures of Tutankhamun. It's a must-visit for history enthusiasts.

attractions_card.title: Cairo Citadel
attractions_card.description: The Cairo Citadel, or Saladin Citadel, is a historic Islamic fortification that offers panoramic views of the city. Within the complex, you can explore beautiful mosques and museums.

attractions_card.title: Coptic Cairo
attractions_card.description: Coptic Cairo is a historic Christian neighborhood in Old Cairo, known for its ancient churches, including the Hanging Church and the Church of St. Sergius and Bacchus.

attractions_card.title: Nile River Cruises
attractions_card.description: Nile River cruises offer a unique way to experience Cairo, with boat trips showcasing the city's landmarks and providing a glimpse of local life along the riverbanks.

attractions_card.title: Al-Azhar Park
attractions_card.description: Al-Azhar Park is a green oasis in the heart of Cairo, offering beautifully landscaped gardens, historic architecture, and a tranquil atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Muizz Street
attractions_card.description: Muizz Street, also known as Al-Muizz li-Din Allah Al-Fatimi Street, is a historic thoroughfare lined with historic buildings, mosques, and shops.

food_card.title: Koshari
food_card.description: Koshari is a beloved Egyptian dish made with rice, lentils, macaroni, and topped with a spicy tomato sauce and fried onions.

food_card.title: Ful Medames
food_card.description: Ful medames is a traditional Egyptian breakfast dish made from fava beans, typically seasoned with herbs, olive oil, and spices.

food_card.title: Shawarma
food_card.description: Shawarma is a popular street food in Cairo, featuring thinly sliced marinated meat (often lamb or chicken) served in pita bread with various toppings and sauces.

food_card.title: Molokhia
food_card.description: Molokhia is a green soup made from jute leaves and often cooked with garlic and coriander. It's a traditional Egyptian comfort food.

food_card.title: Basbousa
food_card.description: Basbousa is a sweet semolina cake soaked in sugar syrup and garnished with almonds or coconut, a popular dessert in Egypt.

hotels_card.title: The Nile Ritz-Carlton
hotels_card.description: The Nile Ritz-Carlton offers luxurious accommodations along the Nile River with breathtaking views and upscale amenities.

hotels_card.alt: Four Seasons Hotel Cairo at Nile Plaza
hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Cairo at Nile Plaza
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons in Cairo provides a high-end experience with Nile views, multiple dining options, and a beautiful rooftop pool.

hotels_card.title: Kempinski Nile Hotel Cairo
hotels_card.description: Kempinski Nile Hotel is a stylish and centrally located hotel offering comfortable rooms and stunning views of the Nile.

hotels_card.title: Mena House Hotel
hotels_card.description: Mena House is a historic hotel located near the Pyramids of Giza, providing a unique and picturesque setting.

hotels_card.title: InterContinental Cairo Semiramis
hotels_card.description: InterContinental Cairo Semiramis is a riverside hotel offering comfortable accommodations and a range of dining options.

transport_card.title: Cairo Metro
transport_card.description: The Cairo Metro is a convenient way to navigate the city, with two lines connecting key areas of Cairo.

transport_card.title: Public Buses
transport_card.description: Public buses serve various parts of Cairo, providing an economical way to get around the city.

transport_card.title: Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Cairo, offering a flexible way to reach your destination. Be sure to use licensed taxi services.

transport_card.title: Cairo International Airport
transport_card.description: Cairo International Airport (CAI) is the primary gateway to the city, offering domestic and international flights.
